It typically grows up to 60-100 cm tall with green foliage and produces small, thin, elongated peppers that turn from green to bright red when mature. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in warm climates with well-drained soil and full sunlight. This plant is widely cultivated for culinary uses, especially in Thai cuisine, where its spicy fruit adds heat to dishes. It is also used as an ornamental plant for its colorful fruits.

It thrives in warm climates and is commonly grown in Southeast Asia, particularly Thailand. Known for its intense heat and distinctive flavor, it is an essential ingredient in many Asian cuisines.

name: Toad Lily
description: Toad Lily, scientifically known as Tricyrtis hirta, is a perennial flowering plant native to Japan. It is recognized for its unique, orchid-like, spotted flowers that typically bloom in late summer to fall. The plant has arching stems with lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are usually purple-spotted on a creamy or light lavender background. Toad Lilies thrive in shaded, woodland environments with moist, well-drained soils, making them popular as shade garden plants. They are valued for their late blooming period which adds color to gardens when many other plants have finished flowering.
